summary: This is a communication from Judge Alison J. Nathan's chambers forwarding a sealed memorandum opinion and order in the case US v. Maxwell (20cr330) to counsel. The document indicates a sealed judicial ruling was issued on November 11, 2021, and will be docketed the following day.

persons.name: Nathan NYSD Chambers
persons.context: The sender of the email, representing the chambers of a judge, transmitting a sealed court order.

persons.name: Jeff Pa liuca
persons.context: An attorney or legal counsel (likely a misspelling of 'Jeff Pagliuca') receiving the sealed court order.

persons.name: Laura Mennin
persons.context: An attorney or legal counsel receiving the sealed court order.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge who issued the sealed memorandum opinion and order in the US v. Maxwell case.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The Honorable Judge whose chambers sent the email, identified as the issuer of the sealed order.

connections.description: Judge Nathan's chambers is communicating a sealed court order to counsel Jeff Pa liuca.
Judge Nathan's chambers is communicating a sealed court order to counsel Laura Mennin.

events.title: Sealed Order Issued in US v. Maxwell
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issued a sealed memorandum opinion and order in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20cr330).

keyFacts: A sealed memorandum opinion and order was issued by Judge Alison J. Nathan on November 11, 2021, in the case US v. Maxwell (docket 20cr330).
The order was transmitted to defense counsel Jeff Pa liuca and Laura Mennin, indicating they are attorneys of record in the case.
The document was to be officially docketed on November 12, 2021, due to the November 11 holiday (Veterans Day).
The communication originates from the official chambers of the presiding judge, confirming its authenticity as a court filing.
The sealing of the opinion and order suggests it contains sensitive information not intended for public disclosure at that time.
